ground_truth: Hi is shaking his head while Gale chuckles, and Hi continues to shake his head as the camera moves closer to show Hi staring glumly at Gale. A motorcycle's rear wheel and fender with twin exhaust pipes are visible, with flames in each pipe as the bike roars. We see from behind the Biker's head as he rides through the night, creeping in toward a window with a feeble yellow light. Hi, composing a letter in voice-over, is hunched over the kitchen table writing, illuminated by a yellow lamp, the only light in the trailer. We creep in on Gale and Evelle sprawled on the sofa and easy chair, on a pimply-faced Cashier asleep behind the counter with a dirty magazine lying open on his chest, on Nathan Jr. asleep in an ottoman armchair in the living room, lit by the TV snow, a half-full glass of milk beside him, his robe disheveled, and eyeglasses slid down his nose, on Ed and Nathan Jr. asleep together in the double bed with Ed's arm draped protectively over the infant. The rumble of the motorcycle starts up again as we see the night sky, and the motorcycle tire enters the frame as it halts, the Biker planting a jackbooted foot while the engine rumbles. We crane up over the Biker's back to reveal his view of a bluff overlooking the trailer park with a glowing yellow light in one trailer window below. The biker sits motionless, legs outstretched against his parked motorcycle, staring at the campfire as we float closer to his face and realize something peculiar: his unblinkingly open eyes show only fire, either a reflection or something burning inside. A jackbooted foot grinds it out, leading into the showroom as the Biker's mail-and-chained fist pushes the door open, jackboots strolling through a showroom of unpainted furniture and fixtures, while the Biker's hand produces a fresh cheroot from nowhere, either sleight-of-hand or magic.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Hi is trembling his head while Gale laughs, and Hi continues to tremble his head as the camera shifts closer to display Hi gazing sadly at Gale. A motorcycle's back wheel and fender with dual exhaust pipes are visible, with flames in each pipe as the bike roars. We observe from behind the Biker's head as he rides through the night, sneaking in toward a window with a weak yellow light. Hi, composing a letter in voice-over, is hunched over the kitchen table scripting, illuminated by a yellow lamp, the only light in the trailer. We sneak in on Gale and Evelle sprawled on the sofa and easy chair, on a pimply-faced Cashier asleep behind the counter with a dirty magazine lying open on his chest, on Nathan Jr. asleep in an ottoman armchair in the living room, lit by the TV snow, a half-full glass of milk beside him, his robe disarranged, and spectacles slid down his nose, on Ed and Nathan Jr. asleep together in the double bed with Ed's arm draped protectively over the infant. The rumble of the motorcycle starts up again as we see the night sky, and the motorcycle tire enters the frame as it stops, the Biker planting a jackbooted foot while the engine rumbles. We crane up over the Biker's back to disclose his view of a bluff overlooking the trailer park with a glowing yellow light in one trailer window below. The biker sits motionless, legs outstretched against his parked motorcycle, staring at the campfire as we glide closer to his face and recognize something unusual: his unblinking open eyes show only fire, either a reflection or something ablaze inside. A jackbooted foot grinds it out, leading into the showroom as the Biker's mail-and-chained fist pushes the door open, jackboots walking through a showroom of unpainted furniture and fixtures, while the Biker's hand produces a fresh cheroot from nowhere, either sleight-of-hand or magic.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Hi is having his head shaken by him while Gale is chuckled at by Hi, and Hi's head continues to be shaken by him as the camera is moved closer to show Gale being stared at glumly by Hi. The rear wheel and fender of a motorcycle with twin exhaust pipes are made visible, with flames in each pipe as the bike is roared by it. The Biker’s head is seen by us from behind as he rides through the night, creeping toward a window with a feeble yellow light. Hi, in voice-over, composes a letter while the kitchen table is written on by him, illuminated by a yellow lamp, the only light in the trailer. Gale and Evelle are crept in on by us, sprawled on the sofa and easy chair, while the pimply-faced Cashier sleeps behind the counter with a dirty magazine lying open on his chest. Nathan Jr. sleeps in an ottoman armchair in the living room, lit by the TV snow, a half-full glass of milk beside him, his robe disheveled, and eyeglasses slid down his nose, while Ed and Nathan Jr. sleep together in the double bed with Ed’s arm draped protectively over the infant. The rumble of the motorcycle is started up again as the night sky is seen by us, and the motorcycle tire enters the frame as the Biker halts it, planting a jackbooted foot while the engine is rumbled by it. We crane up over the Biker’s back to reveal a bluff overlooking the trailer park seen by him with a glowing yellow light in one trailer window below. The biker sits motionless, legs outstretched against his parked motorcycle, staring at the campfire as his face is floated closer to by us and we realize something peculiar: his unblinkingly open eyes show only fire, either reflecting or something burning inside. It is ground out by a jackbooted foot, leading into the showroom as the Biker pushes the door open with his mail-and-chained fist, jackboots strolling through a showroom of unpainted furniture and fixtures, while a fresh cheroot is produced by the Biker's hand from nowhere, either sleight-of-hand or magic.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Hi shakes his head while Gale chuckles, and the camera zooms in on Hi's glum expression. A motorcycle's rear wheel and fender with dual exhaust pipes, emitting flames, are visible as the bike roars. The Biker rides through the night, approaching a window with faint yellow light. Hi, in voice-over, writes a letter at the kitchen table under a yellow lamp, the trailer's sole light. We see Gale and Evelle sprawled on the sofa and chair, a pimply-faced Cashier asleep behind the counter with a dirty magazine on his chest, Nathan Jr. in an armchair, lit by TV snow, with a glass of milk beside him, robe disheveled, glasses slid down, and Ed with Nathan Jr. asleep together, Ed's arm protectively over him. The motorcycle rumbles again; the tire enters the frame and halts, the Biker planting a jackbooted foot while the engine rumbles. We crane over the Biker's back revealing his view of the trailer park with a glowing window below. The Biker sits, legs stretched on the parked bike, staring at the campfire as we float closer, noticing his unblinking eyes show only fire—either reflected or internal. A jackbooted foot grinds it out, leading into the showroom as the Biker's mailed hand pushes the door open, jackboots strolling through a showroom of unfinished furniture as he produces a fresh cheroot through sleight-of-hand or magic.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Hi shakes his head while Gale chuckles and continues shaking as the camera zooms in on Hi's glum stare at Gale. A motorcycle's rear wheel and fender with flames in the exhaust pipes roar. We see from behind the Biker's head as he rides at night toward a dimly lit window. Hi, narrating a letter, writes at the kitchen table under the trailer's only yellow lamp. We see Gale and Evelle on the sofa, a Cashier asleep with an open magazine, Nathan Jr. in an armchair by TV light with glasses askew and a milk glass nearby, and Ed with Nathan Jr. in bed, her arm protectively over him. The motorcycle rumbles as the night sky reveals the Biker halting with a jackbooted foot against his parked bike, facing a bluff overlooking the trailer park. The Biker has motionless, fire-reflecting eyes, possibly burning inside. A jackbooted foot grinds it out, leading into a showroom where the Biker enters, producing a cheroot as if by magic.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Hi is shaking his head from side to side while Gale chuckles softly, and the scene continues with Hi persistently shaking his head as the camera gradually moves closer to offer a more detailed view of Hi, who is staring glumly at Gale. Dominating the background, a motorcycle's rear wheel and fender, equipped with twin exhaust pipes, are prominently visible. Flames leap from each pipe as the bike roars to life with a thunderous sound. We are afforded a view from behind the Biker's head as he rides through the enveloping night, steadily making his way toward a window that emits a feeble, yellow-tinged light. Hi, in voice-over, is composing a letter, hunched over at the kitchen table. He is writing, illuminated by the soft glow of a yellow lamp, which serves as the only source of light in the dimly lit trailer.

As the scene progresses, we slowly shift our focus to Gale and Evelle, who are sprawled out on the sofa and an easy chair, respectively. We then see a pimply-faced Cashier who has fallen asleep behind the counter, with a dirty magazine lying open on his chest. Nathan Jr. appears next, asleep in an ottoman armchair located in the living room. He is faintly lit by the flickering TV snow, with a half-full glass of milk sitting beside him on a small table. His robe is disheveled, and his eyeglasses have slid down his nose. Meanwhile, Ed and Nathan Jr. are peacefully asleep together in the double bed, with Ed's arm draped protectively over the infant. 

The deep rumble of the motorcycle engine starts up again as we observe the vast, dark night sky. The motorcycle tire gradually enters the frame as it comes to a halt, the Biker planting a jackbooted foot firmly on the ground while the engine continues to rumble. We crane up over the Biker's back to reveal the view that unfolds before him—a bluff that overlooks the trailer park, with a single trailer window below glowing with a warm, yellow light. The Biker sits motionless, his legs comfortably outstretched against his parked motorcycle, his gaze fixed on a campfire in the near distance. As we draw closer to his face, we notice something peculiar about his eyes: they remain unblinkingly open, revealing only the flickering firelight, suggesting either a mere reflection or something burning from within. 

A jackbooted foot grinds out the campfire, leading us into a different setting as the Biker's mail-and-chained fist pushes the door open, stepping into a cavernous showroom filled with unpainted furniture and fixtures. The Biker then skillfully produces a fresh cheroot seemingly out of nowhere, an act that could only be described as either sleight-of-hand or a touch of magic.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Hi is shaking his head from side to side, maintaining this motion persistently, while Gale chuckles softly. The scene continues with an increasing focus on Hi, whose head-shaking remains constant as the camera gradually moves closer to provide a more detailed view of Hi himself. He is seated, staring glumly at Gale with a downcast expression. In the background, prominently visible, is a motorcycle's rear wheel and fender, equipped with twin exhaust pipes that draw the viewer’s attention. Flames leap energetically from each exhaust pipe as the powerful bike roars to life with a mighty, thunderous sound. We are afforded a view from behind the Biker’s head, observing as he rides steadily through the enveloping night, making his way toward a particular window that emits a feeble, yellow-tinged light. In voice-over, Hi is composing a letter, hunched over at the kitchen table. He is writing diligently, with the soft, warm glow of a yellow lamp illuminating his form, serving as the only source of light in the dimly lit trailer, casting gentle shadows around him.

As the scene progresses further, our focus gradually shifts to Gale and Evelle, who are sprawled out comfortably, Gale on the sofa and Evelle in an easy chair. Our attention then slides to a pimply-faced Cashier who has fallen asleep behind the counter, with a crumpled, dirty magazine resting open on his chest. Next, Nathan Jr. appears in the scene, sound asleep in an ottoman armchair located in the living room. He is faintly illuminated by the flickering, snowy glow of the TV, with a half-full glass of milk sitting beside him on a small table nearby. His robe is disheveled, and his eyeglasses have slid down his nose, adding to the scene's quiet, domestic realism. Meanwhile, Ed and Nathan Jr. are peacefully asleep together in the double bed, with Ed’s arm draped protectively over the infant, providing a sense of security and warmth.

The deep, resonant rumble of the motorcycle engine starts up once again as we observe the vast, dark night sky stretching out above. The motorcycle's massive tire gradually enters the frame, coming to a halt as the Biker plants a jackbooted foot firmly on the ground, while the powerful engine continues to rumble in the night's stillness. Our perspective cranes up over the Biker's back to reveal the expansive view that unfolds before him—a bluff overlooking the trailer park, with a single trailer window below glowing with a warm, inviting yellow light. The Biker sits motionless, his legs comfortably outstretched against his parked motorcycle, his gaze fixed intently on a campfire burning in the near distance. As we draw closer to his face, we notice something peculiar and striking about his eyes: they remain unblinkingly open, reflecting only the flickering firelight, suggesting either a mere reflection or perhaps something burning mysteriously from within.

A jackbooted foot grinds out the glowing campfire, seamlessly leading us into a different, mysterious setting as the Biker’s mail-and-chain-clad fist decisively pushes the door open. He steps confidently into a cavernous showroom filled with unpainted furniture and various fixtures. With an air of practiced skill, the Biker then produces a fresh cheroot seemingly out of nowhere, an act that could only be described as either sleight-of-hand or a touch of magic, leaving the audience in a state of wonder.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Hi begins by shaking his head persistently while Gale responds with a chuckle, adding a sense of lightness to the moment. Despite Gale's amusement, Hi continues to shake his head vigorously as the camera gradually zooms in to capture Hi's somber expression as he glumly stares at Gale. Nearby, a motorcycle's rear wheel and fender become visible, featuring twin exhaust pipes that unexpectedly emit flames as the bike roars to life. The perspective shifts to a rear view of the Biker's head, providing a sense of movement as he rides through the dark night, stealthily approaching a window emitting a weak yellow glow. Transitioning to a more introspective scene, Hi is seen slumped over a kitchen table, engrossed in writing a letter in voice-over. The dimly lit room is illuminated solely by a yellow lamp casting a warm glow over Hi's focused posture. The ambiance shifts as the camera quietly pans over Gale and Evelle, who are sprawled out on the sofa and in an easy chair respectively. The camera continues to sweep across the room, catching sight of a cashier with a pimply face, slumbering behind a counter with a dirty magazine splayed open on his chest. The scene moves on to Nathan Jr., dozing in an ottoman armchair in the living room, faintly illuminated by the static glow of a TV. Beside him is a half-full glass of milk, his robe is askew, and his small eyeglasses have slid down to the tip of his nose. Shifting again, we see Ed and Nathan Jr. peacefully sleeping side by side in a double bed; Ed’s arm is tenderly draped over the infant, an expression of protective warmth. The tranquility of the night is abruptly broken by the renewed rumble of the motorcycle engine, the night sky serving as a backdrop as the bike tire enters the scene and comes to a stop. The Biker plants a firm, jackbooted foot on the ground, the engine's low rumble vibrating through the air. As the camera cranes over the Biker's back, the view unfolds to reveal a bluff that offers a panoramic view of the trailer park below, one trailer window glowing with yellow light. The Biker remains motionless, legs extended against his stationary motorcycle, captivated by the hypnotic dance of the campfire flames. As we gradually draw closer to his face, an unsettling realization dawns: his eyes remain unnervingly open, reflecting flames that suggest either a mere reflection or something burning fiercely within. With a calculated movement, the Biker grinds out his cigarette, signaling a transition into the showroom as his mail-and-chained fist pushes the door open. His jackboots echo in the quiet space as he strides through a showroom filled with unpainted furniture and fixtures. In a seamless motion, his hand retrieves a fresh cheroot from seemingly nowhere, leaving the viewer to wonder whether it is an act of sleight-of-hand or genuine magic.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Hi shakes his head while Gale chuckles and the camera zooms in to capture Hi's glum expression directed at Gale. Meanwhile, a motorcycle's rear wheel, fender, and flaming exhaust pipes are visible as it roars through the night. The Biker rides toward a dimly lit window as Hi, narrating in a voice-over, writes a letter at the kitchen table under a yellow lamp—the trailer's sole illumination. The scene transitions, showing Gale and Evelle sprawled on the sofa and easy chair, a cash register attendant asleep with a magazine on his chest, Nathan Jr. in a chair bathed in TV snowlight, milk glass beside him, and his robe disheveled, then to Ed and Nathan Jr. sleeping, with Ed protectively draped over the infant. The motorcycle rumbles again, and we see it halt as the Biker plants a boot and observes a trailer park from a bluff, focusing on a glowing trailer window. The Biker sits still, legs outstretched, eyes reflecting fire, whether from within or as a reflection. Crushing out a campfire, the Biker strides into a showroom, revealing a fist in chainmail, pushing open the door while producing a cheroot through sleight-of-hand or magic.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
Hi, a man caught in a tumultuous part of his life, is shaking his head while Gale, who is known for his mischievous sense of humor, chuckles. Hi continues to shake his head as the camera moves closer to show Hi staring glumly at Gale, whose laughter echoes with a hint of their long-standing camaraderie. A motorcycle, resembling those used by outlaw biker gangs, has its rear wheel and fender with twin exhaust pipes visible, with flames in each pipe as the bike roars, reminiscent of a scene from a classic action film. We see from behind the Biker's head, a figure cloaked in mystery and leather, as he rides through the night, creeping in toward a window with a feeble yellow light, the kind often found in isolated trailer parks.

Hi, composing a letter in voice-over with the weight of unspoken emotions, is hunched over the kitchen table writing, illuminated by a yellow lamp, the only light in the trailer, a stark contrast to the darkness outside. We creep in on Gale and Evelle, small-time crooks with a penchant for trouble, sprawled on the sofa and easy chair, on a pimply-faced Cashier, perhaps a young man with dreams eclipsed by night shifts, asleep behind the counter with a dirty magazine lying open on his chest. Nathan Jr., the heart of the household, is asleep in an ottoman armchair in the living room, lit by the TV snow, a half-full glass of milk beside him, his robe disheveled, and eyeglasses slid down his nose. Ed, who embodies the nurturing spirit of the family, sleeps beside Nathan Jr. in the double bed with Ed's arm draped protectively over the infant.

The rumble of the motorcycle starts up again, a sound akin to thunder, as we see the night sky, and the motorcycle tire enters the frame as it halts, the Biker planting a jackbooted foot with military precision while the engine rumbles. We crane up over the Biker's back to reveal his view of a bluff overlooking the trailer park, a landscape dotted with flickering lights, with a glowing yellow light in one trailer window below. The biker sits motionless, legs outstretched against his parked motorcycle, staring at the campfire, its warmth stark against the cool night air, as we float closer to his face and realize something peculiar: his unblinkingly open eyes show only fire, either a reflection or something burning inside, a gaze that suggests an inner turmoil or a fantastical element. A jackbooted foot grinds it out, leading into the showroom as the Biker's mail-and-chained fist, reminiscent of medieval armor, pushes the door open, jackboots strolling through a showroom of unpainted furniture and fixtures, while the Biker's hand produces a fresh cheroot from nowhere, either sleight-of-hand, reminiscent of a magician's trick, or an illusion of magic.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Len is twisting his ankle while Calista guffaws, and Len continues to twist his ankle as the telescope drifts nearer to show Len glaring despondently at Calista. A tractor's front wheel and rim with twin headlights are visible, with bubbles in each light as the vehicle whispers. We glimpse from beyond the Farmer's hat as he glides through the dusk, sliding in toward a door with a faint blue glow. Len, drafting a poem in the background, is crouched over the picnic bench scratching, bathed by a blue lantern, the only glow in the cabin. We slide in on Calista and Olen slumped on the hammock and bean bag, on a freckle-faced Cook snoozing under the table with a clean postcard lying closed on his chin, on Bryan Sr. dozing in a beanbag recliner in the den, lit by the radio static, a half-eaten apple next to him, his shirt ruffled, and sunglasses perched on his ears, on Tim and Bryan Sr. dozing together in the hammock with Tim's leg draped cautiously over the toddler. The murmur of the tractor resumes as we watch the evening clouds, and the tractor rim comes into view as it stops, the Farmer settling a barefooted toe while the engine murmurs. We lift above the Farmer's hat to disclose his perspective of a hill overlooking the cabin lot with a flickering blue glow in one cabin door below. The Farmer remains stationary, feet outstretched beside his parked tractor, looking at the bonfire as we glide nearer to his grin and discern something curious: his unwaveringly open ears hear only wind, either an echo or something whispering inside. A barefooted toe snuffs it out, leading into the boutique as the Farmer's velvet-and-beaded wrist nudges the gate apart, bare toes ambling through a boutique of unfinished pottery and trinkets, while the Farmer's arm uncovers a ripe peach from thin air, either illusion or sorcery.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Hi shakes his head while Gale chuckles, as the camera zooms in to show Hi's glum expression. A motorcycle's rear tire and flames in its exhaust pipes are visible as the Biker rides through the night towards a dimly lit window. Hi writes a letter at the kitchen table, the only light coming from a yellow lamp. We see Gale and Evelle sprawled on the sofa, a cashier asleep with a magazine on his chest, and Nathan Jr. asleep in a chair with a half-full glass of milk nearby. Ed and Nathan Jr. sleep together in the bed, Ed's arm draped over the infant. The motorcycle roars again as the Biker halts, overlooking a trailer park with a single glowing window. The Biker sits motionless, eyes reflecting fire or burning internally. A jackbooted foot grinds out a flame as the Biker's mail-and-chained fist pushes open a showroom door, revealing unpainted furniture, and he seemingly produces a fresh cheroot through sleight-of-hand or magic.
